intro: Heliophila minor, commonly known as lesser heliophyte, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Hydrophyllaceae. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in wet or marshy habitats. The plant features slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Heliophila minor is adapted to moist environments and plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils.
